- Assemble ingredients and follow recipes to prepare large portions of food.
- Cook large quantities of food and check it often to ensure a quality end result.
- Assist in serving students after the food has been prepared.
- Keep the kitchen area where food preparation is taking place clean and sanitized.
- Ensuring equipment is cleaned on a regular basis.
- Follow sanitation and food storage best practices.
- Work rapidly and efficiently in performing job duties.

After 19 weeks, we are excited to welcome our teachers back this week to kick-off the 2020-2021 school year. Though many things might have changed, the heart of our staff to serve the students remains the same.

We look forward to welcoming the students back on Wednesday, August 12.

May 22 at 6:42 PM ¬∑

The Wolves Den is pre-selling masks! Get yours today and we will ship it to you. Two different design options. Visit https://www.bufordwolvesden.com/accessories to order today. Orders will start shipping the week of June 1st. Be on the lookout for a store wide sale coming soon!

‚Ä¢ Slide-in pouch to hold disposable Ô¨Ålters

to help slow the spread of COVID-19

post_text:
** UPDATE - 3/20/20, 11:30am **
So many Wolves wanted the opportunity to donate so we have opened up March 30th for blood donations and volunteer opportunities.

** UPDATE **
Wolves, you are amazing! We will up this blood drive in an hour!! We have reached out to the American Red Cross to see if we can add a second day. When we get details we will let you know.

The American Red Cross had 4,000+ blood drives canceled due to COVID-19 resulting in 150,000 fewer donations at a crucial time. We are opening the Buford Arena for the American Red Cross to hold a much-needed blood drive. The Red Cross will have added staff to make sure there is minimal waiting to adhere to social distancing guidelines.

The following added measures have been put into place to keep everyone safe:

* No walk-ups will be taken. This blood drive is BY APPOINTMENT ONLY.

* Temperatures will be taken upon arrival.

* No children will be allowed.

G I V E ‚û°Ô∏è bit.ly/BCSMarchGiveBlood

post_text:
In accordance with newly issued federal guidance, Governor Brian Kemp signed Executive Order 3.16.20.01 closing all public elementary, secondary, and post-secondary schools in Georgia through March 31, 2020.

Buford City Schools will be closed until March 31. Further guidance will come from the school district in the coming days.
text:
In accordance with newly issued federal guidance, Governor Brian Kemp signed Executive Order 3.16.20.01 closing all public elementary, secondary, and post-secondary schools in Georgia through March 31, 2020.

Buford City Schools will be closed until March 31. Further guidance will come from the school district in the coming days.

post_text:
Beginning Tuesday, March 17, our school nutrition team members will prepare meals to be delivered by our transportation department to specified locations.

We are prepared to provide this service to our students should the closure be extended beyond March 20th.

post_text:
Apply online: https://www.applitrack.com/buford/onlineapp/

Primary Function
- The Custodian has duties to provide building maintenance and cleanliness and to support classroom and administrative operations.

Responsibilities/Duties
- Sweeps, mops, waxes, and dusts.
- Washes/clean windows, walks, floors, dry erase boards, chalkboards, and furnishings.
- Picks up paper and other debris, empties and cleans trash receptacles.
- Waters plants, cleans planter boxes, and performs minor trimming and weeding.
- Rearranges and moves furnishings, transports and delivers educational supplies.
- Operates vacuums, floor machines, buffers, and carpet cleaning equipment.
- Participates in professional learning.
- Performs other duties as assigned.
shared_text:

The Wolves Den is now available online! They have plenty of dress code friendly items that are great for students, family members and friends! You can shop online anytime at bufordwolvesden.com. By shopping at The Wolves Den, you are supporting Buford's marketing and DECA students.

Thursday, December 19th is the last day to place online orders to receive them before winter break. Orders are available for pick up at BHS up until Friday, December 20th at 3:00pm.

Please email wolvesden@bufordcityschools.org if you have any questions!

For #GivingTuesday we are collecting donations to support our Academic Booster Club (ABC). The ABC sponsors parties for Honor Roll students each semester, awarding prizes and gifts. Every Spring, students who have achieved academic excellence or have earned distinguished academic honors are invited to the annual Academic Booster Club Awards Program, where awards and scholarship money are awarded. Our funding for these events comes from community and parent donations.

post_text:
Coach Ryan Daniel was known for telling students to strive to "get better", so the Foundation set up in his honor provides scholarships to BHS seniors that are furthering their education in the effort to "get better." This Saturday, November 23, 2019, the annual Ryan Daniel 5K race will take place with all proceeds going to the Ryan Daniel Scholarship Fund that will be awarded to BHS graduates.

Join our Buford community to walk or run in this 5K race to honor Ryan as well as support our students.

September 17, 2019 at 3:27 PM ¬∑

Once a Wolf, always a Wolf. Chick-fil-A Peach Bowl honored Buford City Schools' former student AC Hollis and her hard-fought battle with cancer with a $20M donation to Children's Healthcare of Atlanta. Thanks for remembering AC! #LoveBuford #LoveGwinnett

Learn More About AC's Legacy: https://gwinnettmagazine.com/bufords-ac-hollis-honored-with-20m-choa-donation/
text:
#TeamAC has been busy around Buford this weekend as they found several ways to remember Anna Charles. What an amazing gift that Chick-fil-A Peach Bowl gave Children's Healthcare of Atlanta to honor her legacy!

post_text:
Make plans to cheer on our Wolves as they face Milton High School this Friday at Coolray Field!

Tickets can be purchased now through GoFan. (link in comments)

Also, BHS students can purchase tickets from Ms. Durnell in the Commons during lunch on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday.

The public can purchase tickets from Ms. Wilson in the BHS front office during regular school hours.

All pre-sale tickets are $13. Tickets purchased at the gate will be $18.
